leaf_cluster_name: 计算系统生物学与动力学生态
typical_objects: ODE/PDE 模型, 代谢网络, 信号通路, 参数与不确定性
task_chain: 建模→参数估计→仿真→敏感性/UQ→反演→验证
tool_form: 建模语言/仿真器 + 参数估计/UQ + 数据拟合工作流

tools.name: sbml2cellml
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) to CellML format
tools.detailed_description: A Ruby-based utility program designed to convert biological models defined in SBML format into CellML format, facilitating interoperability between these two major systems biology standards.

tools.name: AutoKEGGRec
tools.one_line_profile: Automated metabolic network reconstruction tool using KEGG data
tools.detailed_description: An automated tool implemented in MATLAB that creates draft metabolic network reconstructions for single organisms or communities based on KEGG database information, supporting the generation of consolidated reconstructions.

tools.name: PathSBML
tools.one_line_profile: PathVisio plugin for importing SBML models as SBGN diagrams
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the pathway analysis tool PathVisio that allows users to import SBML models and visualize them as SBGN-PD (Systems Biology Graphical Notation - Process Description) diagrams.

tools.name: Paxtools
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for the BioPAX biological pathway exchange standard
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Java library providing an object model, API, and utilities for manipulating, validating, and querying BioPAX data, a standard language for biological pathway exchange.

tools.name: paxtoolsr
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for BioPAX pathway analysis and Paxtools
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides functions to interact with BioPAX OWL files using Paxtools and to query the Pathway Commons molecular interaction database.

tools.name: SBML.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface to the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML)
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing an interface to the libSBML library, allowing users to read, write, and manipulate SBML models directly within the Julia programming environment.

tools.name: pyvipr
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization widget for systems biology models in Jupyter
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool providing static and dynamic visualizations for systems biology models (PySB, BNGL, SBML) within Jupyter notebooks, aiding in model debugging and communication.

tools.name: iBioSim
tools.one_line_profile: CAD tool for modeling and design of genetic circuits
tools.detailed_description: A computer-aided design (CAD) tool for the modeling, analysis, and design of genetic circuits, with support for importing/exporting SBML and SBOL standards.

tools.name: PEtab
tools.one_line_profile: Data format and library for parameter estimation in systems biology
tools.detailed_description: A repository defining the PEtab standard for specifying parameter estimation problems in systems biology (based on SBML and TSV), including Python libraries and validators for the format.

tools.name: ChiBE
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis tool for BioPAX pathways
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for visualizing, querying, and analyzing biological pathways and networks represented in the BioPAX format, often used with Pathway Commons data.

tools.name: cytoscape-sbgn-stylesheet
tools.one_line_profile: Cytoscape.js stylesheet for SBGN visualization
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library providing a Cytoscape.js stylesheet to render biological networks according to the Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) standard.

tools.name: sbgnml-to-cytoscape
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from SBGN-ML to Cytoscape.js JSON
tools.detailed_description: An npm module and utility for converting Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) XML files into JSON format compatible with Cytoscape.js for web-based visualization.

tools.name: CellMLToolkit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for CellML model simulation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library that connects CellML models to the Scientific Julia ecosystem (SciML), enabling high-performance simulation and analysis of physiological models.

tools.name: cobrar

tools.detailed_description: An R package for the constraint-based reconstruction and analysis (COBRA) of metabolic networks, providing tools for flux balance analysis and network manipulation.

tools.name: Antimony
tools.one_line_profile: A modular human-readable model definition language for systems biology
tools.detailed_description: The reference implementation (library and parser) for Antimony, a text-based, human-readable language designed for defining and modularizing systems biology models.

tools.name: BioSimulations
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for sharing and reusing biomodeling studies
tools.detailed_description: A web platform and associated tools for sharing, visualizing, and simulating biological models, promoting reproducibility in systems biology research.

tools.name: BioSimulators

tools.detailed_description: A registry and set of utilities for containerized biosimulation tools that adhere to a standard command-line interface, facilitating the execution of diverse biological simulations.

tools.name: Biosimulators_test_suite

tools.detailed_description: A utility tool for validating that biosimulation software tools correctly implement the BioSimulators standards and command-line interfaces.

tools.name: rust_sbml

tools.name: CellML API

tools.name: libSBGN.js

tools.name: SBML2LaTeX

tools.name: SBSCL

tools.name: SBTabEditor

tools.name: pymCADRE

tools.name: CoReCo

tools.name: CombineArchive

tools.name: libSEDML

tools.name: Flint

It supports simulation and analysis of biological dynamics.

tools.name: JSim
tools.one_line_profile: Java-based simulation system for physiology and biomedicine
tools.detailed_description: JSim is a simulation system for building quantitative numeric models and analyzing them against experimental data. While general, it is primarily focused on physiology and biomedicine (Physiome project).

tools.name: flux-data-qaqc
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for energy balance closure analysis and eddy flux data post-processing
tools.detailed_description: This Python package provides tools for Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QAQC) of eddy covariance flux data, including energy balance closure analysis, which is critical for ecological and environmental studies.

tools.name: flux-ratio-based-gibbs-energy
tools.one_line_profile: Determination of reaction free energy via metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB tool to determine the free energy of reactions and their confidence intervals using metabolic flux analysis and optimization techniques. It integrates thermodynamics with flux analysis.

tools.name: FastSL
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for rapid evaluation of synthetic lethal sets in metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: FastSL is a MATLAB toolbox designed to rapidly identify synthetic lethal gene or reaction sets in genome-scale metabolic models. It is useful for identifying potential drug targets in pathogens or cancer cells.

tools.name: gsmodutils
tools.one_line_profile: Utility framework for the management of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: gsmodutils provides a set of utilities for managing, curating, and validating genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs). It assists in the standardization and quality control of metabolic network reconstructions.

tools.name: Recon3D
tools.one_line_profile: A 3-Dimensional view of human metabolism and disease model
tools.detailed_description: Recon3D is a genome-scale metabolic model of humans that integrates metabolic network data with 3D protein structure information. It enables the analysis of metabolic variations and disease states in a structural context.

tools.name: cobradb
tools.one_line_profile: Relational database loader for genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: COBRAdb is a tool to load genome-scale metabolic models and genome annotations into a relational database. It serves as the backend for BiGG Models, facilitating the storage, querying, and distribution of metabolic models.

tools.name: cobrame
tools.one_line_profile: COBRApy extension for models of metabolism and expression (ME-models)
tools.detailed_description: cobrame is a Python package that extends COBRApy to support the construction and analysis of ME-models (Metabolism and Expression models). These models account for the proteome allocation constraints in addition to metabolic fluxes.

tools.name: ecolime
tools.one_line_profile: Tools and data for the E. coli K-12 ME-model iJL1678b-ME
tools.detailed_description: ecolime contains the specific data and scripts required to build the iJL1678b-ME model of E. coli K-12. It works in conjunction with cobrame to generate this specific organism-scale model.

tools.name: ssbio
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for structural systems biology
tools.detailed_description: ssbio is a Python framework designed to work with genome-scale models and protein structures. It provides tools to map protein structures to metabolic models, analyze structural properties, and visualize results.

tools.name: SBMLToolkit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: SBML model importer for Julia's SciML ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: SBMLToolkit.jl allows users to import SBML (Systems Biology Markup Language) models into the Julia SciML ecosystem (ModelingToolkit.jl). It enables high-performance simulation and analysis of biological models using Julia's differential equation solvers.

tools.name: DLKcat
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for enzyme turnover number (kcat) prediction
tools.detailed_description: DLKcat uses deep learning and Bayesian approaches to predict enzyme turnover numbers (kcat) from protein sequences and substrate information. This data is crucial for improving enzyme-constrained genome-scale metabolic models (ecGEMs).

tools.name: Human-GEM
tools.one_line_profile: Generic genome-scale metabolic model of Homo sapiens
tools.detailed_description: Human-GEM is a comprehensive, community-curated genome-scale metabolic model of humans. It serves as a central repository and tool for studying human metabolism, disease mechanisms, and personalized medicine.

tools.name: MuscleATPProductionSimulation
tools.one_line_profile: Models and simulation scripts for muscle ATP production
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains enzyme-constrained stoichiometric models and scripts for simulating ATP production in muscle fibers. It includes both small-scale and whole-body metabolic models for studying muscle metabolism.

tools.name: RAVEN Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for genome scale model reconstruction, curation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: RAVEN (Reconstruction, Analysis and Visualization of Metabolic Networks) is a MATLAB toolbox for genome-scale metabolic model reconstruction, curation, and analysis. It supports automated reconstruction from homology and constraint-based modeling.

tools.name: SingleCellModeling
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for generating context-specific metabolic models from scRNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides the code and workflow for generating and analyzing context-specific genome-scale metabolic models derived from single-cell RNA-Seq data, enabling the study of metabolic heterogeneity at the single-cell level.

tools.name: hanpo-GEM
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale metabolic model of Hansenula polymorpha
tools.detailed_description: hanpo-GEM is a genome-scale metabolic model for the yeast Hansenula polymorpha (Ogataea polymorpha). It is used for simulating metabolism and guiding metabolic engineering efforts in this organism.

tools.name: cbmpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python platform for constraint based modelling and analysis
tools.detailed_description: CBMPy is a Python-based platform for constraint-based modeling (CBM) of biological networks. It supports Flux Balance Analysis (FBA), Flux Variability Analysis (FVA), and other network analysis methods.

tools.name: dynamic-community-fba
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis for microbial communities
tools.detailed_description: This repository implements Dynamic Community FBA, a method for simulating the dynamic interactions and growth of microbial communities using flux balance analysis over time.

tools.name: CobraMod
tools.one_line_profile: Package for modifying and extending genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: CobraMod is a Python package that simplifies the process of modifying genome-scale metabolic models. It allows users to easily add new pathways from databases or curated datasets to existing models.

tools.name: Growth-coupling-suite
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for computing microbial strain designs coupling target reaction to growth
tools.detailed_description: A constraint-based metabolic modeling workflow designed to compute and analyze microbial strain designs. It focuses on coupling a target reaction to cellular growth, facilitating metabolic engineering strategies.

tools.name: cameo
tools.one_line_profile: Computer Aided Metabolic Engineering & Optimization library
tools.detailed_description: A high-level Python library for metabolic engineering and optimization. It provides a modular framework for simulation, analysis, and design of metabolic models, supporting various constraint-based methods.

tools.name: incawrapper
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) using INCA
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that provides an interface to INCA (Isotopomer Network Compartmental Analysis), facilitating Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) workflows and adding additional functionalities for data handling.

tools.name: multitfa
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate thermodynamics-based metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing multivariate thermodynamics-based metabolic flux analysis (TFA). It integrates thermodynamic constraints into metabolic models to improve flux prediction accuracy.

tools.name: CarveMe
tools.one_line_profile: Automated reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool for the automated reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic models for microbial species and communities. It uses a top-down approach to 'carve' models from a universal template.

tools.name: CNApy
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated visual environment for metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application providing an integrated visual environment for metabolic modeling. It supports Flux Balance Analysis (FBA), Flux Variability Analysis (FVA), Elementary Flux Modes (EFM), and other advanced metabolic network analysis methods.

tools.name: ModelPolisher
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to annotate SBML models using BiGG Models knowledgebase
tools.detailed_description: A tool that automatically annotates and curates SBML models by accessing the BiGG Models knowledgebase. It helps improve model quality and compliance with standards.

tools.name: SBMLme
tools.one_line_profile: Library for encoding ME models in SBML
tools.detailed_description: A Java library for encoding Metabolism and Expression (ME) models using the SBML standard. It supports the representation of complex macromolecular synthesis processes.

tools.name: refineGEMs
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for curation of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to assist in the curation and quality improvement of genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs), offering various checks and refinement functions.

tools.name: reconstructor
tools.one_line_profile: Automated GENRE building tool from gene fastas
tools.detailed_description: A COBRApy-compatible tool for automated Genome-Scale Metabolic Network Reconstruction (GENRE) building. It creates models directly from gene FASTA files based on KEGG annotations.

tools.name: metabolic-allele-classifiers
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classifier for microbial GWAS using flux balance analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool that integrates flux balance analysis (FBA) with machine learning to classify metabolic alleles for microbial Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS).

tools.name: spatial-sbml
tools.one_line_profile: Libraries and tools for spatial simulation of SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A set of libraries and tools designed to support the spatial simulation of biological models encoded in the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML).

tools.name: metaGEM
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for generating context-specific genome-scale metabolic models from metagenomics
tools.detailed_description: An integrated workflow for reconstructing genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs) directly from metagenomic data and predicting metabolic interactions within microbial communities.

tools.name: mfapy
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolbox for 13C metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing 13C-based Metabolic Flux Analysis (13C-MFA), supporting model construction, simulation, and flux estimation.

tools.name: INDRA
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated Network and Dynamical Reasoning Assembler
tools.detailed_description: An automated model assembly system that interfaces with NLP systems and databases to collect knowledge and produce causal graphs and dynamical models for systems biology.

tools.name: cobra-ai
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox of interpretable VAE models for COBRA
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox providing interpretable Variational Autoencoder (VAE) models tailored for Constraint-Based Reconstruction and Analysis (COBRA) data.

tools.name: Newt
tools.one_line_profile: Web application to visualize and edit pathway models
tools.detailed_description: A web-based editor and visualizer for biological pathway models, supporting standards like SBGN (Systems Biology Graphical Notation).

tools.name: BOFdat
tools.one_line_profile: Generate biomass objective functions from experimental data
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate biomass objective function stoichiometric coefficients for genome-scale metabolic models using experimental data inputs.

tools.name: surfin_fba
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic FBA for use with COBRApy metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing dynamic Flux Balance Analysis (dFBA) simulations, integrated with the COBRApy framework.

tools.name: gapseq
tools.one_line_profile: Prediction and analysis of bacterial metabolic pathways and networks
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for the informed prediction of bacterial metabolic pathways and the reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic networks from genome sequences.

tools.name: FBA-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for generation and simulation of personalized FBA models
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to generate and simulate personalized Flux Balance Analysis models, likely for biomedical applications.

tools.name: FluxGAT
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network for predicting gene essentiality from flux data
tools.detailed_description: A Graph Neural Network (GNN) model that predicts gene essentiality by utilizing graphical representations derived from flux sampling data, reducing reliance on objective functions.

tools.name: autopacmen
tools.one_line_profile: Adds protein allocation constraints to metabolic models (sMOMENT)
tools.detailed_description: A tool that retrieves kcat data and automatically adds protein allocation constraints to stoichiometric metabolic models following the sMOMENT method.

tools.name: StrainDesign
tools.one_line_profile: Computational design of metabolic networks based on COBRApy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the computational design of metabolic networks (strain design), built upon the COBRApy framework.

tools.name: PyBNF
tools.one_line_profile: Parameterization of biological models in SBML and BNGL formats
tools.detailed_description: An application for the parameterization and optimization of biological models (SBML, BNGL) using parallelization and metaheuristic algorithms.

tools.name: Raven
tools.one_line_profile: De novo genome assembler for long uncorrected reads
tools.detailed_description: Raven is a de novo genome assembler specifically designed for long uncorrected reads (such as those from Oxford Nanopore or PacBio). It optimizes the assembly process to handle high error rates in long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: PyFBA
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of flux balance analysis
tools.detailed_description: PyFBA is a Python package for flux balance analysis (FBA) to model microbial metabolism. It allows users to build models from genomes, gap-fill them, and run FBA simulations.

tools.name: mergem
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for merging and comparing genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: Mergem is a command-line tool and Python package for merging, comparing, and translating genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs), facilitating the integration of different metabolic reconstructions.

tools.name: bamfa
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: BAMFA implements Bayesian metabolic flux analysis, allowing for the estimation of metabolic fluxes with uncertainty quantification using Bayesian inference methods.

tools.name: dfba
tools.one_line_profile: Encoding Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis in SBML
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides methods and specifications for encoding Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis (dFBA) problems directly within the SBML format, facilitating the standardization of dynamic metabolic modeling.

tools.name: fbc_curation
tools.one_line_profile: FROG analysis for reproducibility of FBC models
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for performing FROG (Flux Balance Analysis Reproducibility of Models) analysis, ensuring the reproducibility and quality control of Flux Balance Constraints (FBC) models.

tools.name: neo4sbml
tools.one_line_profile: Neo4j representation of SBML model components
tools.detailed_description: Neo4sbml enables the import and representation of SBML model components and annotations into a Neo4j graph database, facilitating complex queries and network analysis of metabolic models.

tools.name: scobra
tools.one_line_profile: Extension of cobrapy for metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: Scobra is a Python package that extends COBRApy, providing additional functionality and simplified interfaces for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of metabolic networks.

tools.name: fbar
tools.one_line_profile: Flux Balance Analysis package with a tidy data approach
tools.detailed_description: fbar is an R package for Flux Balance Analysis that emphasizes a 'tidy data' approach, making it easier to integrate metabolic modeling into data analysis pipelines in R.

tools.name: aspefm
tools.one_line_profile: Computing Elementary Flux Modes with Answer Set Programming
tools.detailed_description: aspefm uses Answer Set Programming (ASP) to compute Elementary Flux Modes (EFMs) in metabolic networks, offering an alternative logic-based approach to pathway analysis.

tools.name: metaRange
tools.one_line_profile: Mechanistic & metabolic constrained species range simulations
tools.detailed_description: metaRange is an R package for simulating species ranges by integrating mechanistic and metabolic constraints, bridging ecology and metabolic modeling.

tools.name: MICOM
tools.one_line_profile: Metabolic modeling of microbial communities
tools.detailed_description: MICOM is a Python package for the metabolic modeling of microbial communities. It allows for the integration of metagenomic data to simulate the metabolic interactions within microbiomes.

tools.name: Riptide
tools.one_line_profile: Reaction Inclusion by Parsimony and Transcript Distribution
tools.detailed_description: Riptide is a tool for creating context-specific metabolic models by integrating transcriptomic data with genome-scale metabolic networks using a parsimonious approach.

tools.name: Mackinac
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge between ModelSEED and COBRApy
tools.detailed_description: Mackinac serves as a bridge library connecting ModelSEED (a resource for metabolic models) and COBRApy, facilitating the use of ModelSEED models within the COBRApy environment.

tools.name: FluxML
tools.one_line_profile: Universal Modeling Language for Metabolic Flux Analysis
tools.detailed_description: FluxML defines a standardized modeling language for Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) and provides tools for parsing and processing these models.

tools.name: tEFMA
tools.one_line_profile: Thermodynamically feasible elementary flux modes calculator
tools.detailed_description: tEFMA is a tool for calculating elementary flux modes (EFMs) that are thermodynamically feasible, integrating thermodynamic constraints into pathway analysis.

tools.name: fishualize
tools.one_line_profile: Color scales and silhouettes for plotting fish in R
tools.detailed_description: Fishualize is an R package providing scientifically accurate silhouettes and color scales based on teleost fishes, used for enhancing biological data visualization.

tools.name: COBRA.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based reconstruction and analysis in Julia
tools.detailed_description: COBRA.jl is the Julia implementation of the COBRA toolbox, providing high-performance tools for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of metabolic networks.

tools.name: COBRApy
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based modeling of metabolic networks in Python
tools.detailed_description: COBRApy is a comprehensive Python package for constraint-based modeling of metabolic networks. It supports FBA, FVA, gene deletion studies, and handles standard formats like SBML.

tools.name: The COBRA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-Based Reconstruction and Analysis Toolbox for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: The COBRA Toolbox is the industry-standard MATLAB suite for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of biochemical networks, offering a vast array of algorithms for metabolic modeling.

tools.name: memote
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale metabolic model test suite
tools.detailed_description: Memote is a testing suite for genome-scale metabolic models. It provides a standardized set of tests to assess model quality, consistency, and annotation, generating detailed reports.

tools.name: d3flux
tools.one_line_profile: D3.js-based visualization library for metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that produces D3.js-based interactive visualizations of metabolic networks and flux distributions, designed to work with cobrapy models.

tools.name: dFBA
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis implementation in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis (dFBA) to simulate the dynamic behavior of metabolic networks over time.

tools.name: pgp_reconstruction
tools.one_line_profile: Pathway-Guided Pruning for metabolic model reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Implements the Pathway-Guided Pruning (PGP) algorithm for the reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic models.

tools.name: corda
tools.one_line_profile: Cost Optimization Reaction Dependency Assessment for model reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the CORDA (Cost Optimization Reaction Dependency Assessment) algorithm for reconstructing genome-scale metabolic models from experimental data.

tools.name: moccasin
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for MATLAB ODE models to SBML format
tools.detailed_description: MOCCASIN (Model ODE Converter for Creating Automated SBML Interoperability) translates basic ODE-based MATLAB models of biological processes into the standardized SBML format.

tools.name: SBMLImporter.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Import SBML models into Julia SciML ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package to import SBML dynamic models into the SciML ecosystem, enabling simulation via Jump (Gillespie), SDE, and ODE solvers.

tools.name: spatial-model-editor
tools.one_line_profile: Editor and simulator for spatial bio-chemical reaction models
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for editing and simulating spatial bio-chemical reaction models, supporting SBML spatial extensions.

tools.name: Spatial_Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial model simulator using SBML
tools.detailed_description: A C++ simulator for executing spatial simulations based on SBML models, focusing on reaction-diffusion systems.

tools.name: DifferentiableMetabolism.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable constraint-based metabolic modeling in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package enabling differentiable constraint-based metabolic modeling, allowing for gradient-based optimization and integration with machine learning workflows.

tools.name: Escher.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of metabolic models in Julia/Makie
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for visualizing metabolic models and flux distributions using the Makie plotting ecosystem, inspired by the Escher web tool.

tools.name: AMAS
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Model Annotation System for SBML models
tools.detailed_description: AMAS predicts and adds annotations to species and reactions in SBML models to improve model quality and interoperability.

tools.name: simplesbml
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified Python interface for creating SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that simplifies the process of building SBML models programmatically without requiring direct interaction with the complex libSBML API.

tools.name: DCcov
tools.one_line_profile: Drug repositioning using Flux Balance Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A computational tool for drug repositioning of single drugs and drug combinations utilizing Flux Balance Analysis (FBA) on metabolic models.

tools.name: chimera
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for genome-based metabolic network reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline for the reconstruction, evaluation, and visualization of genome-scale metabolic networks.

tools.name: Escher
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization tool for metabolic pathways and gene regulatory networks
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for building, sharing, and embedding visualizations of metabolic pathways. It supports the visualization of flux balance analysis (FBA) data and integrates with COBRA models.

tools.name: GEMsembler
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for assembling and comparing Genome-Scale Metabolic Models (GEMs)
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to facilitate the assembly and comparison of various types of Genome-Scale Metabolic Models (GEMs), supporting the reconstruction process in systems biology.

tools.name: cell-eval
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive suite for evaluating cellular perturbation prediction models
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to evaluate the performance of computational models that predict cellular responses to perturbations (e.g., CRISPR, drugs), facilitating benchmarking in systems biology.

tools.name: qupath-extension-cellpose
tools.one_line_profile: QuPath extension for Cellpose integration
tools.detailed_description: An extension enabling the use of Cellpose, a deep learning-based cellular segmentation tool, directly within the QuPath bioimage analysis software environment for whole slide image analysis.

tools.name: Protein-Localization-Transformer
tools.one_line_profile: Zero-shot text-to-image synthesis for protein localization
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of CELL-E, a model for predicting and synthesizing protein localization patterns from text descriptions using a transformer-based architecture.

tools.name: ApPredict
tools.one_line_profile: Cardiac action potential prediction under drug-induced block
tools.detailed_description: A Chaste extension for predicting changes in cardiac action potentials resulting from drug-induced ion channel block, used in cardiotoxicity safety pharmacology.

tools.name: Chaste
tools.one_line_profile: Cancer, Heart and Soft Tissue Environment simulation package
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose simulation package aimed at multi-scale, computationally demanding problems arising in biology and physiology, specifically focusing on cancer, heart, and soft tissue modeling.

tools.name: CompuCell3D
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-cell simulation environment using GGH model
tools.detailed_description: A flexible, scriptable modeling environment for simulating complex multi-cellular systems using the Glazier-Graner-Hogeweg (GGH) model (Cellular Potts Model).

tools.name: WholeCell
tools.one_line_profile: Mycoplasma genitalium whole-cell model
tools.detailed_description: The source code for the first complete computational model of a whole cell (Mycoplasma genitalium), integrating multiple cellular processes.

tools.name: WholeCellEcoliRelease
tools.one_line_profile: Whole-cell model of Escherichia coli
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive computational model of the E. coli cell, simulating its life cycle and cellular processes.

tools.name: WholeCellKB
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge base software for whole-cell models
tools.detailed_description: A database platform designed to store, organize, and retrieve the extensive biological data required for building and parameterizing whole-cell simulations.

tools.name: WholeCellSimDB
tools.one_line_profile: Database for whole-cell model simulation results
tools.detailed_description: A hybrid SQL/HDF database system for storing, indexing, and retrieving the massive datasets generated by whole-cell simulations.

tools.name: WholeCellViz
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for whole-cell simulations
tools.detailed_description: A web-based visualization tool for exploring and analyzing the complex, high-dimensional data produced by whole-cell models.

tools.name: vEcoli
tools.one_line_profile: Vivarium-based E. coli whole-cell model
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the E. coli whole-cell model using the Vivarium framework for composable biological simulations.

tools.name: wcEcoli
tools.one_line_profile: Whole-cell E. coli model codebase
tools.detailed_description: The codebase for the Covert Lab's whole-cell E. coli model, enabling simulation of cellular physiology.

tools.name: DEMENTpy
tools.one_line_profile: Spatially explicit microbial systems modeling framework
tools.detailed_description: A trait- and individual-based modeling framework for simulating microbial community dynamics and ecosystem processes in a spatially explicit manner.

tools.name: MorpheuS
tools.one_line_profile: Neural dynamic 360-degree surface reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A neural rendering approach for reconstructing dynamic 3D surfaces from monocular RGB-D video, applicable in computer vision and potentially biological structure imaging.

tools.name: HybridML
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for hybrid mechanistic and machine learning modeling
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to combine mechanistic modeling with machine learning approaches, facilitating the creation of hybrid models for complex systems.

tools.name: datanator
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for whole-cell modeling data aggregation
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for discovering, aggregating, and processing the diverse biological data required for parameterizing whole-cell models.

tools.name: wc_lang
tools.one_line_profile: Language for describing whole-cell models as reaction networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that defines the schema and data structure for whole-cell models, enabling the description of models as reaction networks.

tools.name: wc_model_gen
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for designing whole-cell models from large datasets
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for systematically and scalably generating whole-cell models by integrating large datasets.

tools.name: wc_rules
tools.one_line_profile: Rule-based modeling library for whole-cell models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for rule-based modeling, specifically designed to support the complexity of whole-cell simulations.

tools.name: wc_sim
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-algorithmic simulator for whole-cell models
tools.detailed_description: A simulator that executes whole-cell models using multiple algorithms to handle different biological processes concurrently.

tools.name: COSMOS
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of spatially resolved multi-omics data using GNNs
tools.detailed_description: A computational tool that uses graph neural networks to integrate and analyze spatially resolved multi-omics data.

tools.name: PhysiCell
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based multicellular simulator
tools.detailed_description: A flexible and scalable physics-based simulator for multicellular systems, widely used in cancer research and tissue engineering.

tools.name: IAN
tools.one_line_profile: Intelligent System for Omics Data Analysis and Discovery
tools.detailed_description: An R-based system designed to facilitate the analysis and discovery process in omics data research.

tools.name: PK-Sim
tools.one_line_profile: Whole-body physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) modeling tool
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software tool for whole-body physiologically based pharmacokinetic modeling, allowing simulation of drug distribution in the body.

tools.name: PhysiCell Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical editor and visualization tool for PhysiCell models
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for creating, editing, and running PhysiCell models, as well as visualizing simulation results.

tools.name: python-loader
tools.one_line_profile: Data loader for PhysiCell digital snapshots
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility library for loading and processing data generated by PhysiCell simulations.

tools.name: RatInABox
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of movement and spatial cell types in continuous environments
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for simulating agent movement and neural activity (e.g., place cells, grid cells) in continuous environments, used in neuroscience research.

tools.name: FUSF Hydrophone Scanner
tools.one_line_profile: Software and hardware design for ultrasound transducer characterization
tools.detailed_description: Open-source software and hardware design for a hydrophone scanner used to spatially characterize ultrasound transducers.

tools.name: XFEM_Fracture2D
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab solver for 2D fracture problems using Extended Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab program for solving fracture problems involving arbitrary multiple crack propagations in 2D linear-elastic solids.

tools.name: TechnoEconomicCellSelection
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization tool for battery cell selection in electric trucks
tools.detailed_description: A tool to assist in selecting the optimal battery cell for long-haul truck electrification based on techno-economic criteria.

tools.name: vivarium
tools.one_line_profile: WebGPU-powered toolkit for cellular automata simulation
tools.detailed_description: A modern toolkit leveraging WebGPU for creating and running cellular automata simulations.

tools.name: BIONIC
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for biological network integration and analysis
tools.detailed_description: BIONIC (Biological Network Integration using Convolutions) is a deep learning-based tool that integrates multiple biological networks to produce high-quality, low-dimensional node features containing topological and functional information.

tools.name: morpheus.R
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for the Morpheus matrix visualization and analysis widget
tools.detailed_description: Provides an R interface to the Morpheus JavaScript library, enabling interactive heatmaps and matrix visualization/analysis directly from R environments.

tools.name: morpheus.js
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive matrix visualization and analysis tool for omics data
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for versatile matrix visualization and analysis, widely used for gene expression heatmaps, clustering, and exploratory data analysis in systems biology.

tools.name: Morpheus (Proteomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Mass spectrometry-based proteomics database search algorithm

tools.name: JAXtronomy
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated differentiable gravitational lensing simulation
tools.detailed_description: A JAX port of the lenstronomy package, enabling parallelized, GPU-accelerated, and differentiable simulations of gravitational lensing. It is used for modeling strong lensing systems and inferring mass distributions.

tools.name: SBINN
tools.one_line_profile: Systems-biology-informed neural networks for parameter identification
tools.detailed_description: A framework for identifiability analysis and parameter identification in systems biology models using physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) tailored for biological dynamics.

tools.name: pySINDy
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse Identification of Nonlinear Dynamics (SINDy) algorithm implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the Sparse Identification of Nonlinear Dynamics (SINDy) method, enabling the discovery of governing dynamical systems equations from data.

tools.name: delfi
tools.one_line_profile: Density estimation likelihood-free inference toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for density estimation likelihood-free inference (DELFI), used for simulation-based inference in neuroscience and systems biology (predecessor to sbi).

tools.name: GATSBI
tools.one_line_profile: Generative Adversarial Training for Simulation-Based Inference
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for performing simulation-based inference, allowing for efficient parameter estimation in complex models.

tools.name: Simformer
tools.one_line_profile: Transformer and diffusion model based simulation-based inference
tools.detailed_description: A flexible all-in-one simulation-based inference framework combining transformers and diffusion models to handle complex posterior distributions.

tools.name: PINA
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural networks for Advanced modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing an intuitive interface for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) to solve differential equations and model physical systems.

tools.name: Differentiable Simulation AM
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization tool for additive manufacturing using automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: An optimization framework leveraging automatic differentiation for simulation and process optimization in additive manufacturing contexts.

tools.name: Hypothesis
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for simulation-based inference and mechanization of science
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for simulation-based inference (SBI), providing algorithms for likelihood-free inference and scientific hypothesis testing.

tools.name: DIMOS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Molecular Simulator framework
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for machine-learning enhanced differentiable molecular simulations, enabling gradient-based optimization of molecular parameters.

tools.name: DiffCloth
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable cloth simulation with dry frictional contact
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine specifically for cloth simulation, supporting gradient-based optimization for physical parameters and control.

tools.name: AeroSandbox
tools.one_line_profile: Aircraft design optimization via automatic differentiation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for aircraft design optimization that leverages automatic differentiation for fast and accurate aerodynamic, propulsion, and structural analysis.

tools.name: VMAS
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized Multi-Agent Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A vectorized, differentiable physics simulator designed for efficient multi-agent reinforcement learning benchmarking and simulation.

tools.name: CGDMS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable molecular simulation of proteins
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable molecular simulation tool for proteins using a coarse-grained potential, enabling gradient-based optimization of molecular structures.

tools.name: Rewarped
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning in differentiable multiphysics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A framework for reinforcement learning within differentiable multiphysics simulations, built on NVIDIA Warp.

tools.name: NeuralLaplace
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Laplace Reconstructions for modeling time-series dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Neural Laplace, a method for learning diverse differential equation environments using Laplace reconstructions. It offers O(1) complexity for modeling time observations and serves as an alternative to Neural ODEs for modeling complex dynamics.

tools.name: CellBox
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable machine learning for perturbation biology
tools.detailed_description: A framework for modeling cellular responses to perturbations using an interpretable machine learning approach. It combines ODE models with neural networks to infer interaction networks and predict system behavior under drug or genetic perturbations.

tools.name: sbibm
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking framework for simulation-based inference algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmarking suite for simulation-based inference (SBI) methods. It provides a collection of reference tasks, metrics, and utilities to evaluate and compare the performance of different SBI algorithms systematically.

tools.name: sbi
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for simulation-based inference (likelihood-free inference)
tools.detailed_description: A standard library for simulation-based inference (SBI), enabling parameter estimation for complex simulators where the likelihood is intractable. It implements state-of-the-art neural inference methods (SNPE, SNLE, SNRE) to perform Bayesian inference.

tools.name: QTensorAI
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid quantum-classical neural network simulation platform
tools.detailed_description: A platform for simulating hybrid quantum-classical neural networks using tensor networks. It leverages QTensor for efficient quantum circuit simulation and integrates with PyTorch for differentiable training of hybrid models.

tools.name: socialforce
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Social Force simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Social Force Model for simulating particle or agent dynamics. It is fully differentiable, allowing for parameter optimization and integration into machine learning pipelines for analyzing crowd dynamics or biological cell migration.

tools.name: paltas
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based inference pipeline for strong gravitational lensing
tools.detailed_description: A software package designed to conduct simulation-based inference on strong gravitational lensing systems. It generates realistic lensing simulations and trains neural posterior estimators to infer lens parameters from observational data.

tools.name: MarineHydro.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable boundary element simulations for hydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for performing differentiable boundary element method (BEM) simulations. It is designed for the design and optimization of offshore structures by simulating wave-structure interactions.

tools.name: synference
tools.one_line_profile: SBI-based Spectral Energy Distribution (SED) fitting tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for flexible Spectral Energy Distribution (SED) fitting in astronomy, powered by simulation-based inference. It integrates with the Synthesizer framework to infer physical properties of galaxies from photometric data.

tools.name: RoboDojo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable simulator for robotic systems
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics simulator written in Julia, designed for robotic systems. It enables gradient-based optimization for control and dynamics learning tasks.

tools.name: jwave
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based differentiable acoustic simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A research framework for differentiable and parallelizable acoustic simulations using JAX. It supports execution on CPUs, GPUs, and TPUs, enabling efficient forward modeling and inversion for acoustic problems.

tools.name: harissa
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and inference of gene regulatory networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the simulation and inference of gene regulatory networks (GRNs) based on a mechanistic model of transcriptional bursting. It allows for generating realistic single-cell gene expression data and inferring network structures from data.

tools.name: CIE-R-Package
tools.one_line_profile: Causal Inference and Directional Enrichment for biological networks
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing methods for causal inference and directional enrichment analysis on biological networks. It helps in identifying active pathways and regulatory mechanisms from omics data.

tools.name: albatross
tools.one_line_profile: SBI library for stellar stream analysis
tools.detailed_description: A simulation-based inference library specifically designed for analyzing stellar streams in the Milky Way. It facilitates the estimation of potential parameters and stream properties using likelihood-free methods.

tools.name: swyft
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable system for scientific simulation-based inference
tools.detailed_description: A library for efficient simulation-based inference, implementing Truncated Marginal Neural Ratio Estimation (TMNRE). It is designed to scale to complex scientific simulators and high-dimensional parameter spaces, widely used in cosmology and physics.

tools.name: marginaleffects
tools.one_line_profile: R package for model interpretation and marginal effects
tools.detailed_description: An R package to compute and plot predictions, slopes, marginal means, and comparisons for various statistical and ML models. It supports uncertainty estimation via delta method, bootstrapping, and simulation-based inference, making it a powerful tool for statistical analysis in science.

tools.name: sbi_pp
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based inference customized for astronomical applications
tools.detailed_description: A library providing simulation-based inference tools tailored for astronomical tasks, such as photometric redshift estimation. It builds upon standard SBI methods to address domain-specific challenges in astronomy.

tools.name: diff-surfel-tracing
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable 2D Gaussian ray tracer
tools.detailed_description: A fully differentiable 2D Gaussian ray tracer built on OptiX. It supports multiple-bounce path tracing for complex light transport simulation and is designed for integration into optimization and inverse rendering tasks.

tools.name: Py_PSNODE
tools.one_line_profile: Neural ODE and DAE modules for power system modeling
tools.detailed_description: A library providing general neural Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) and Differential Algebraic Equation (DAE) modules specifically for power system dynamic modeling. It facilitates the integration of neural networks with physical power system models.

tools.name: APDTFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Time series forecasting framework using Neural ODEs
tools.detailed_description: A modular forecasting framework for time series data that leverages Neural ODEs, transformers, and probabilistic modeling. It allows researchers to experiment with and deploy advanced deep learning models for dynamic system forecasting.

tools.name: ExeterUQ
tools.one_line_profile: Uncertainty quantification and history matching for climate models
tools.detailed_description: A framework for performing emulation and history matching (calibration) on process-based climate models. It provides statistical tools to tune model parameters and quantify uncertainty, addressing the computational expense of running full climate simulations.

tools.name: memote-m-capsulatus
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale metabolic model of Methylococcus capsulatus
tools.detailed_description: A curated genome-scale metabolic model (GEM) for the organism Methylococcus capsulatus. This repository contains the model files used for flux balance analysis and metabolic simulation, serving as a specific scientific artifact for computational biology.

tools.name: LAB-Bench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for AI capabilities in biology research
tools.detailed_description: A dataset and evaluation framework designed to benchmark AI systems on tasks fundamental to biological research, such as literature retrieval, protocol planning, and data interpretation. It supports the development of AI agents for science.

tools.name: BILN
tools.one_line_profile: Bioinformatician’s Interactive Lab Notebook
tools.detailed_description: A specialized electronic lab notebook and logging system designed for bioinformaticians. It helps track experiments, datasets, and workflows to ensure reproducibility and structured logging in computational biology research.

tools.name: DeepFlow
tools.one_line_profile: History matching using deep generative models
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation for performing history matching (inverse modeling) in reservoir engineering and subsurface flow problems. It utilizes deep generative models to parameterize geological fields and enable efficient gradient-based optimization.

tools.name: Model-SEED-core
tools.one_line_profile: Core libraries for genome-scale metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: The core Perl libraries for the ModelSEED framework, used for reconstructing, curating, and analyzing genome-scale metabolic models. It supports tasks such as gap-filling, flux balance analysis, and model annotation.

tools.name: sim-parameter-estimation
tools.one_line_profile: Calibration tool for robotics simulators
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for estimating parameters of physics simulators to match real-world data (Sim-to-Real). While focused on robotics, the underlying methods for differentiable simulation and parameter inference are relevant to physical modeling and calibration tasks in AI for Science.

tools.name: Macrophage_framework
tools.one_line_profile: Predictive framework for modeling macrophage activation and heterogeneity
tools.detailed_description: An R-based framework that contextualizes macrophage heterogeneity across tissues and inflammatory conditions. It provides a predictive model to map activation profiles to conserved activation paths.

tools.name: SBMLToolkitTestSuite.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking and validation suite for SBMLToolkit against the SBML Test Suite
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package designed to run the standard SBML Test Suite using SBMLToolkit, generating logs and reports to verify the correctness and compliance of SBML processing tools.

tools.name: hmer
tools.one_line_profile: R package for Bayes Linear emulation and history matching of computer models
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for performing history matching and emulation, primarily used for calibrating complex deterministic computer models (simulators) in fields like epidemiology and systems biology.

tools.name: BioPartsDB
tools.one_line_profile: DNA synthesis workflow system for synthetic biology
tools.detailed_description: A workflow management system designed for synthetic biology laboratories to manage DNA synthesis processes, parts registries, and assembly workflows.

tools.name: biomedical
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for curating biomedical training data for large-scale language modeling
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and tools developed by the BigScience workshop for processing, filtering, and curating biomedical text data for training Large Language Models (LLMs) in the scientific domain.

tools.name: Biosimulators
tools.one_line_profile: Registry and CLI for containerized biosimulation tools
tools.detailed_description: A platform and command-line interface that provides a standard way to execute various biosimulation tools (simulators) using Docker containers, facilitating reproducibility in systems biology.

tools.name: rbio
tools.one_line_profile: Biologically-informed reasoning model trained on virtual cell models
tools.detailed_description: A reasoning model developed to perform inference and verification tasks based on virtual cell models, enabling biologically grounded AI reasoning.

tools.name: FitBenchmarking
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for comparing minimizers on scientific fitting problems
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to compare the performance (run time and accuracy) of various minimization algorithms (optimizers) against a set of standard fitting problems. It is widely used in scientific data analysis contexts, such as neutron scattering, to evaluate fitting software.

tools.name: BioModelAnalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for constructing and verifying biological models
tools.detailed_description: BioModelAnalyzer (BMA) is a tool that allows scientists to model biological systems (such as gene regulatory networks) and perform formal verification to prove stabilization and other properties. It combines a graphical interface with a formal analysis engine.

tools.name: ChannelWorm
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for modeling C. elegans ion channels
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools and curated datasets designed to build quantitative models of C. elegans ion channels. It supports the OpenWorm project by providing data and methods to simulate ion channel dynamics.

tools.name: ChannelWorm2
tools.one_line_profile: Updated tools for C. elegans ion channel modeling
tools.detailed_description: The second iteration of the ChannelWorm toolkit, providing notebooks and scripts for processing data and building models of C. elegans ion channels.

tools.name: PyTeCK
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic testing and validation tool for chemical kinetic models
tools.detailed_description: PyTeCK is a Python tool designed to automatically test and validate chemical kinetic models against experimental data. It facilitates the benchmarking of reaction mechanisms by comparing simulation results with observational data.

tools.name: EconML
tools.one_line_profile: Automated learning and intelligence for causal inference and effect estimation
tools.detailed_description: EconML is a Python package that applies state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to econometrics and causal inference. It provides a toolkit for estimating heterogeneous treatment effects and performing causal analysis, which is applicable in various scientific domains including systems biology and medicine.

tools.name: DoWhy
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for causal inference and causal modeling
tools.detailed_description: DoWhy is a Python library for causal inference that supports explicit modeling and testing of causal assumptions. It combines causal graphical models with potential outcomes frameworks to enable robust causal analysis and refutation.

tools.name: Refinery Platform
tools.one_line_profile: Data management, analysis, and visualization system for bioinformatics
tools.detailed_description: The Refinery Platform is a comprehensive system for managing, analyzing, and visualizing bioinformatics and computational biology data. It integrates a data repository with a Galaxy-based workflow engine and visualization tools.

tools.name: SBML Test Suite
tools.one_line_profile: Conformance testing system for SBML software support
tools.detailed_description: The SBML Test Suite is a system designed to test the correctness and degree of SBML (Systems Biology Markup Language) support in software packages. It serves as a benchmark and quality control tool for systems biology software.

tools.name: libOmexMeta
tools.one_line_profile: Library for managing semantic annotations of biosimulation models
tools.detailed_description: libOmexMeta is a library that provides support for reading, writing, editing, and managing semantic annotations for biosimulation models, adhering to the OMEX metadata standards.

tools.name: AMBER (Automated Modelling)
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Modelling for Biological Evidence-based Research
tools.detailed_description: A computational tool designed for automated construction and refinement of biological models based on experimental evidence. It likely employs algorithms to infer model structures or parameters (e.g., in metabolic or signaling networks) from data, fitting within the scope of systems biology modeling.
